alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 03 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Residual flooding caused by earlier rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of DC and central Maryland, including the following counties: in DC, District of Columbia. In central Maryland, Montgomery and Prince Georges. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is ongoing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding and water rescues, especially along Rock Creek, Sligo Creek, and the Anacostia. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bethesda... Hillandale... College Park... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Fort Totten... University of Maryland... Potomac... Hyattsville... White Oak... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... Kemp Mill... Chevy Chase... South Kensington... Riverdale Park... Forest Glen... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
